Evaluation.explanation: The candidate demonstrates proficiency in Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, and familiarity with C/C++. They have experience with Spring Boot, ReactJS, and NextJS frameworks. Their projects showcase practical application of these technologies. The resume lists relevant coursework, indicating a foundational understanding of computer science principles. The candidate's tech stack is relevant to the job description, but the depth of knowledge in C# and .NET, as requested in the job description, is not explicitly stated and needs further verification. Overall, the candidate shows a good technical base with room for growth in specific areas.

The candidate's participation in competitive programming (ACM/ICPC) and algorithm competitions suggests strong problem-solving skills. The project descriptions highlight the use of technologies like debounce for optimizing server load and implementation of authentication and authorization mechanisms, indicating analytical abilities. The candidate also provides the Github repository, so it is possible to see how the projects were implemented. The award in The 2023 ICPC Vietnam National Programming Contest also confirms the candidate's analytical skills.

The candidate's project experience suggests involvement in various stages of the SDLC, including design, development, and implementation. The project descriptions mention features like API documentation and security implementation, indicating awareness of important SDLC aspects. The candidate's involvement in group projects, such as FoodHub, also implies experience with collaborative development processes. However, there's a lack of specific details on their experience with planning, analysis, and maintenance phases of the SDLC. The candidate also provides the link to the project's overview, so it is possible to see how the software development lifecycle was followed.

The candidate's participation in team-based projects (FoodHub) and involvement in the WebDev Studio and ACM/ICPC BootCamp suggest good collaboration skills. The resume does not explicitly highlight communication skills, but the project descriptions are well-written and explain the project's purpose and features clearly. Further assessment of communication skills would be required through an interview to evaluate their ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. The project overview also confirms the candidate's communication skills.

The candidate's active participation in workshops and training sessions focused on the latest web development technologies and best practices indicates a willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies. Their project portfolio demonstrates the use of various frameworks and technologies, suggesting adaptability. The resume highlights engagement in self-study, so it indicates a learning agility. However, there's no explicit evidence of handling unexpected changes or challenges in previous roles. Their participation in the ACM/ICPC BootCamp also indicates that the candidate is a fast learner.

The CV doesn't explicitly mention experience with testing methodologies or test-driven development (TDD). The code samples are not provided in the CV, so it is impossible to evaluate the code's readability, clarity, and adherence to coding standards. This area requires further investigation during the interview process.

The candidate lists MySQL and PostgreSQL under 'Database' in the skills section, indicating knowledge of SQL databases. Their projects, OptiMart and FoodHub, utilize PostgreSQL, further validating their experience. However, the depth of knowledge and experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL), specifically mentioned in the job description, is not clear. The candidate's knowledge of SQL is enough to rate this section positively, but further investigation is required.

The candidate mentions JavaScript and TypeScript as programming languages and has experience using Next.js and ReactJS. The projects demonstrate the use of these technologies for building user interfaces. This indicates a strong understanding of web technologies and their application in real-world projects.

The candidate lists Git and GitHub under 'Tools' in the skills section, indicating experience with version control systems. The inclusion of GitHub repository links for the projects further validates their use of Git for managing code changes and collaborating on projects.

The candidate provides no explicit details on troubleshooting and debugging skills. Although not directly mentioned, the candidate's programming experience and problem-solving skills suggest a basic level of debugging ability. More information is needed to accurately assess their capabilities in this area.
